jdText:
FinanceFlow is building the next generation of payment infrastructure. We're looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our core platform team.

What you'll do:
- Design and build scalable microservices handling millions of transactions
- Write high-quality, tested code in Go and Python
- Collaborate with product and design on API contracts
- Participate in on-call rotation for production systems
- Mentor junior engineers on best practices

Qualifications:
- 5+ years of backend development experience
- Strong systems design skills
- Experience with distributed systems, databases (PostgreSQL, Redis)
- Proficiency in Go or Python
- Understanding of financial systems and compliance (PCI-DSS, SOC2)
- BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
resumeText:
Alex Chen
Software Engineer

WORK EXPERIENCE:
Software Engineer, PaymentTech (2019-Present)
- Built payment processing APIs handling 10M+ transactions/day
- Architected event-driven microservices using Go, Kafka, PostgreSQL
- Reduced API latency from 300ms to 50ms through caching and optimization
- Led migration from monolith to microservices architecture
- On-call for production incidents; maintained 99.95% uptime SLA

Software Engineer, CloudSystems (2017-2019)
- Developed backend services in Python (Django, Flask)
- Implemented RESTful APIs and GraphQL endpoints
- Worked with MySQL, Redis for data persistence and caching

EDUCATION:
BS Computer Science, UC Berkeley (2017)

TECHNICAL SKILLS:
Go, Python, PostgreSQL, Redis, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, System Design
notesText: Recruiter reached out on LinkedIn. Role is for NYC office (hybrid 3 days/week). Base range: $180k-$220k + equity + 401k match. Interview process: phone screen, tech screen, onsite (4 rounds), team fit chat.
